title: keen gbc box-manual scans
content: In the Commander Keen newsletter, I saw a link for box and manual scans of Commander Keen GBC.  I don't think much of Keen GBC as a quality GBC game or as a quality Keen game, but I do want to see the box and manual.  I got my version used from amazon.com, so I don't have the box or manual.  The link took me to commanderkeen.net, which no longer exists.  Does anyone know where I can download scans of the box and manual?

title: Re: keen gbc box-manual scans
content:
hi nice to see a new member [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
about you question i got my commander keen gbc out of a toy store [called Intertoys] for a bargain so yes i've got the box and manual but i don't have a scaner i do have digital and can make photo's but i don't know where they are


ps i do hope you only want photo's of the cover [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img]

EDIT : WOW precise 1 hour difference [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] [url=http://profile.xfire.com/memsys][img]http://miniprofile.xfire.com/bg/bg/type/2/memsys.png[/img][/url]

title: Keen GBC box-manual scans
content:
Yeah, digital camera snapshots will be fine. I just want to know what they look like and be able to read the manual. The more high-resolution the better. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Is there a copy of the ones originally at commanderkeen.net? That'd be quick and easy to get.

title: Re: Keen GBC box-manual scans
content:
i have the manual lying around somewhere (although i think the pages are falling out), and im pretty sure i still have the box. I'll try and scan them if i can.-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

content:

title: keen gbc box/manual scans
content:
Thanks everyone! I was surprised at how much response I got! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

It had taken me so long to figure out about the shootable blocks, and there it was right in the manual...bummer.

And it took a moderate effort to figure out how many points it took for a life when I was trying to beat the game w/out continues...and there's the number in plain sight in the manual.

Their descriptions of the monsters are definitely terrible imitations of the real Keen monsters. They seem to think that the Dood resembles Shelly and that Robo Red resembles the PC Robo Red.

Too bad about all those missing pages, but what I did get was worth it. Thanks again! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: keen gbc box/manual scans
content:
Thats because they treated Keen as some old game they could make money off of rather than something they could improve on with a storyline they could respect.

Same thing happened with Jazz Jackrabbit, rip graphics, warp the storyline, could've been much better.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord
